intro: Calophyllum touriga, commonly known as African shea tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces a valuable fruit that contains a high amount of oil, which is used in cosmetics and traditional medicine. Its bark and leaves are also used for their medicinal properties. Calophyllum touriga plays an important role in both ecological and economic systems in its native region.
